answers.text:
Hi Susanna, 
There are many interesting examples of successful recycling programs on the Knowledge Network. Here are a few samples to help you get started on your own recycling program in St. Paul. 
-Colorado Springs, CO Announces Greener Corners Public Space Recycling Programhttp://icma.org/en/Article/102174/Colorado_Springs_CO_Announces_Greener_Corners_Public_Space_Recycling_Program
-15 Tips for going green, recycling http://icma.org/en/icma/newsroom/highlights/Article/103585/Fifteen_Tips_for_Going_Green_Recycling
-E-waste recycling program: reusing resources for the future http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/6692/Ewaste_Recycling_Program_Reusing_Resources_for_the_Future
-This is a previously asked question on innovative recycling programs http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/question/21721
These are just a few of the many resources we have on the Knowledge Network so take a few minutes and conduct a search through the documents section or the site in general. You can also try asking a sustainability oriented group this question so you have a more targeted audience. 
I hope you find this information useful. 
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org

answers.author: Leslie Beauregard
answers.text:
Charlottesville has been doing a pilot program for several years that we want to now roll out citywide.  It's the large recycling bins with every other week pickup.  It's coming up on a future Council agenda I believe.  Check out this website to see the item when it's posted:  http://www.charlottesville.org/index.aspx?page=3525. I believe it will be on the March 17th agenda.

author: Susanna Wilson
text:
The City of West St. Paul, MN is researching successful recycling programs throughout the United States.  
Has your city developed a new or innovative recycling program that you would be willing to share information or email materials?  If not, do you know of any communities that have new, innovative, or successful recycling programs?
I would appreciate any information that you would have to share.   (The city currently has open collection for trash and recycling.  However, we would appreciate if you have information on organized collection programs as well.)
Thank you very much for your assistance and please feel free to contact me with any questions or concerns.  
Sincerely,
Susanna Wilson
City of West St. Paul
1616 Humboldt Avenue
West St. Paul, MN 55118
651-552-4144
swilson@cityofwsp.org
title: Successful Recycling Programs
